feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 3:40PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Water Levels and Ice Jam Potential on Interior Rivers... Spring breakup is picking up speed in the Middle Tanana Valley and across the Interior with the warm temperatures this past week and over the weekend. Significant melting of the snowpack was observed in the Fairbanks area and now that water is rapidly making its way into the waterways. Rivers and stream around Fairbanks continue
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

cap:geocode.value: AKZ221 AKZ222 AKZ223 AKZ224 AKZ225 AKZ226

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued May 01 at 2:00PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * SURF...Surf heights of 10 to 13 feet is impacting all shores of the islands. * TIMING...through Monday * IMPACTS...large surfs and strong rip currents. Fautuaga mo galu maualuluga
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Freeze Watch issued May 01 at 9:59PM PDT until May 03 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 29 possible. * WHERE...Southern Trinity, Northwestern Mendocino Interior, Northern Trinity and Southern Humboldt Interior Counties. * WHEN...From late Monday night through Tuesday morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Trinity; Northwestern Mendocino Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior; Southern Trinity

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued May 01 at 2:53PM PDT until May 02 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 8 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...West winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. Locally stronger gusts in wind prone locations. * WHERE...Surprise Valley California, Lassen-Eastern Plumas- Eastern Sierra Counties and Northern Washoe County. * WHEN...From 7 AM to 8 PM PDT Monday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued May 01 at 2:53PM PDT until May 02 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...West winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. Locally stronger gusts in wind prone locations. Sierra ridge wind gusts near 100 mph. Waves 2 to 4 feet on area lakes.

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued May 01 at 2:53PM PDT until May 02 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...West winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. Locally stronger gusts in wind prone locations. Ridge wind gusts 75-90 mph. * WHERE...Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties and Mono County. * WHEN...From 1 PM to 8 PM PDT Monday.

Winds will shift to west northwest Monday morning. * WHERE...In California, Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties and Modoc County. In Oregon, Klamath Basin, Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County and Central
entry.cap:areaDesc: Modoc County; Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 12:35AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Prowers, central Kiowa and northeastern Bent Counties through 115 AM MDT... At 1235 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Neeoshe Reservoir, or 19 miles north of Lamar, moving northeast at 40 mph.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Kiowa County; Lamar Vicinity, Prowers County; Las Animas Vicinity, Bent County; Western Kiowa County

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 12:29AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Kit Carson County through 115 AM MDT... At 1228 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles west of Bonny Reservoir to 11 miles south of Bethune. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail.

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued May 01 at 11:25PM MDT until May 03 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A Fire Weather Watch remains in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening for gusty winds and low relative humidity values for fire weather zones 224...225...229 and 230...which includes the San Luis Valley, the Sangre de Cristo and Wet Mountain Ranges, the Wet Mountain Valley, Huerfano and western Las Animas Counties...
entry.cap:areaDesc: Huerfano County Including Walsenburg; San Luis Valley Including Alamosa, Del Norte, Fort Garland, Saguache; Southern Front Range Including Sangre De Cristo Mountains, Wet Mountains, La Veta Pass; Western Las Animas County Including Trinidad and Thatcher

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 01 at 9:19PM MDT until May 02 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. * WHERE...Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range. * WHEN...Until Noon MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Snow covered roads will make travel hazardous. Plan on slippery road
entry.cap:areaDesc: South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued May 01 at 4:59PM EDT until May 02 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Coastal Broward, Coastal Palm Beach and Coastal Miami- Dade Counties. * WHEN...Through Monday evening.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Coastal Broward County; Coastal Miami Dade County; Coastal Palm Beach County

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 01 at 3:06PM HST until May 02 at 6:00AM HST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR THE BIG ISLAND SUMMITS ABOVE 12500 FEET ELEVATION... .A moist unstable airmass will bring periods of freezing rain and drizzle, as well as the snow to the Big Island summits through late tonight. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 01 at 1:47PM MDT until May 03 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MONDAY TO 3 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 7 inches, except 5 to 11 inches on ridge tops and elevations above passes. * WHERE...Galena, Galena Summit, Stanley, Clayton, Copper Basin.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 01 at 2:57PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RAIN AND SNOWMELT IS CAUSING NEAR RECORD FLOWS ON AREA RIVERS... A melting and moisture rich snowpack is causing rises on area rivers. Areas along rivers across northeast Minnesota, particularly along the Rainy, Big Fork, Little Fork, and Vermilion Rivers, to name a few, are approaching high flows. The Vermilion River at Crane Lake is nearing its record flow! While we don`t have official river

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 12:11AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Dense Fog Tonight... Patchy dense fog has started to develop across parts of the mountains, as well as the Foothills and Piedmont behind yesterday`s rainfall. Fog will likely continue to develop overnight, until the front arrives which is currently positioned in southeast West Virginia and moving eastward.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 02 at 1:55AM CDT until May 02 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM CDT FOR CENTRAL ROBERTS COUNTY... At 154 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 19 miles northwest of Codman, or 20 miles northwest of Miami, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 1:46AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Dimmit County through 230 AM CDT... At 146 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gilson Groves, or 16 miles south of Carrizo Springs, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 1:44AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Kinney and southeastern Val Verde Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 143 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Del Rio, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued May 01 at 2:57PM CDT until May 02 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... ...MODERATE RIP CURRENT RISK TONIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Aransas Islands, Kleberg Islands, Nueces Islands and Calhoun Islands Counties.

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued May 01 at 5:31PM MDT until May 02 at 3:00AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...West through Northwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...South Central Utah and Glen Canyon Recreation Area/Lake Powell. * WHEN...Until 3 AM MDT Monday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Glen Canyon Recreation Area, Lake Powell; South Central Utah

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued May 01 at 5:31PM MDT until May 02 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Northwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Castle Country, especially along SR-10 from Castle Dale through Fremont Junction. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 AM MDT Monday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 12:11AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Dense Fog Tonight... Patchy dense fog has started to develop across parts of the mountains, as well as the Foothills and Piedmont behind yesterday`s rainfall. Fog will likely continue to develop overnight, until the front arrives which is currently positioned in southeast West Virginia and moving eastward.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued May 01 at 9:15PM AST until May 03 at 6:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves between of 6 to 8 feet. * WHERE...Northwest to eastern beaches of Puerto Rico, including Culebra and across all the U.S. Virgin Islands.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 2:02PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Periods of Snow Tonight and Monday Morning... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Periods of snow. Accumulations of 4 to 8 inches with locally higher amounts around 10 inches above 9000 feet. Snow accumulation of 1 to 2 inches around South Pass.
